prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Band 8
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: This SG has not been conducted in cycle2, although a part of the Band 6 has been delivered.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We will simultaneously observe the lines of N2H+(J=5-4) and N2D+(J=5-4) which can be used to estimate the deuterium fractionation ratio of other type of molecul es if detected, which is compared with that of carbon-chain molecules. In addition, HDO, 34SO, H2CO, HNC, and NH2 lines are included as the bonus lines. The former 2 species are shock related species, which is used to understand the outflow effect, if those species are detected, whereas the later 3 species are so calle d standard molecules which are thus useful to understand the kinematic structure of the CH3D emitting region. Note that the 12m array data rate of this Band 8 fre quency setting is less than 12 MB/s even with the above bonus lines.

In our PdBI data combined with the IRAM 30 m data, the distributions of CCH and c-C3H2 show double-peak structure with a size scale of 2.5"x5" (Figure 5a in the scientific justification (SJ)). Furthermore, our Cycle 0 observation shows coexistence of the more compact (1"-1.5" scale) components (Figure 5e in the SJ). As described in the SJ, we use the JK=2K-1K lines for definitive detection of CH3D, we do not need the extended component. Hence, ACA is not used for Band 8. The beam averaged intensity of the CH3D JK=10-00 line (232 GHz. Band 6) detected toward L1527 is 12 mK with the 32" beam of HHST 10 m (Figure 3 in the scientific justification (SJ)).

When we assume the rotational temperature of CH3D to be 25 K which is the evaporation temperature of CH4 from grain mantle, the intensities of the JK=2K-1K K=0 line is estimated to be 25.5 mK. Thus the averaged brightness temperature within the above distribution (2.5"x5"x2regions) is estimated to be 1040 mK. When we consider the missing flux of 40 %, we need 11.15 mJy/1"beam (65 mK) in order to delineate the image with a reasonable S/N ratio of 10 sigma. Here, the velocity resolution of 0.474 km/s (1ch=0.157 km/s and 3 channel s are binded) is assumed. Although the Band 8 observation requires the good observing condition, the observation of the JK=2K-1K (K=0, 1) lines make the detection of CH3D secure. For compact structures, we can derive the temperature and the column density in combination with the JK=10-00 line observed in Band 6. Furthermore, the distribution of CH3D in the inner envelope can be studied in detail with the 1" resolution, which is used for quantitative interpretations of the WCCC effect. Although L1527 is the northern object, its maximum elevation is as high as 40 degrees from the ALMA site. Therefore, we expect reasonable observing condition even in Band 8.
Here the frequency resolution of 732.423 kHz(~0.473 km/s) is used for the sensitivity calculation. For the stronger lines we will discuss the velocity structure, and hence, we set the velocity resolution of 0.16-0.18 km/s.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Band6
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: The total power data had not been taken in cycle 2. Thus, we only request the total power data of this science goal.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We will simultaneously observe the lines of CCD (N=3-2) and c-C3HD. Since we have the CCH (N=3-2) and c-C3H2 (3 lines with different upper state energy) maps observed with Cycle 0 program, we can evaluate the deuterium fractionation ratio with 1.5" beam. Then, we can estimate the abundance of gas-phase CH4 from that of CH3D, because CCH and c-C3H2 are thought to be formed from evaporated CH4 from grain mantles. The CCD (N=3-2) and the c-C3HD line are detected with >100 mK with the IRAM 30 m telescope (10" beam), and hence, they can be detected with the above sensitivity. CCD has many hyperfine component lines so that we need large bandwidth of 117 MHz. In addition, N2D+, DCN, CH3CCD, H2S, H2O(v=2), and HCO2+ can be observed simultaneously, as the bonus lines. The former 3 species can be used to estimate the deuterium fractionation ratio of other type of molecules if detected, which is compared with that of carbon-chain molecules. Note that J=5-4 line of N2H+ is included in the Band 8 frequency setting. The later 3 species are shock related species, which is used to understand the outflow effect, if those species are detected. N2D+ also has hyperfine components and CH3CCD has a different K lines, and hence we need large bandwidth of 117 MHz. Thus, we need large "data rate" which exceeds the "policy" value of 12 MB/s.

In our PdBI data combined with the IRAM 30 m data, the distributions of CCH and c-C3H2 show double-peak structure with 2.5"x5" size scale (Figure 5a in the SJ). Furthermore, our Cycle 0 observation shows coexistence of the more compact (1"-1.5" scale) components (Figure 5e in the SJ). Thus, we need a very sensitive observation which can delineate extended (12") and compact (1.5") structures, in order to verify the WCCC effect by comparing the distributions of CH3D and carbon-chain molecules such as CCH and c-C3H2. We therefore employ ACA in the observation. The beam averaged intensity of the CH3D JK=10-00 line (232 GHz. Band 6) detected toward L1527 is 12 mK with the 32" beam of HHST 10 m (Figure 3 in the scientific justification (SJ)).

In L1527, the typical velocity line width is 0.5 km/s. Thus the averaged brightness temperature within the above distribution (2.5 arcsec x 5 arcsec x 2 regions) is estimated to be 470 mK. With the rms noise of 47 mK with the velocity resolution of 0.474 km/s (1ch=0.157 km/s and 3 channels are binded), we will be able to obtain the CH3D map with a reasonable S/N ratio of 10 sigma. The spatial resolution of 1.5 arcsec is assumed to delineate the inner structure.

In the Previous proposal, it was recommended. And actually, the 7m data of ACA has been delivered. However, only the total power measurement has not been done yet. We need it for the completion of this program.

This is the same frequency setting to the previous proposal. A part of the data has already delivered, and so, we need the TP data for the same frequency setting. --- We will simultaneously observe the lines of CCD (N=3-2) and c-C3HD. Since we have the CCH (N=3-2) and c-C3H2 (3 lines with different upper state energy) maps observed with Cycle 0 program, we can evaluate the deuterium fractionation ratio with 1.5" beam. Then, we can estimate the abundance of gas-phase CH4 from that of CH3D, because CCH and c-C3H2 are thought to be formed from evaporated CH4 from grain mantles. The CCD (N=3-2) and the c-C3HD line are detected with >100 mK with the IRAM 30 m telescope (10" beam), and hence, they can be detected with the above sensitivity. CCD has many hyperfine component lines so that we need large bandwidth of 117 MHz. In addition, N2D+, DCN, CH3CCD, H2S, H2O(v=2), and HCO2+ can be observed simultaneously, as the bonus lines. The former 3 species can be used to estimate the deuterium fractionation ratio of other type of molecules if detected, which is compared with that of carbon-chain molecules. Note that J=5-4 line of N2H+ is included in the Band 8 frequency setting. The later 3 species are shock related species, which is used to understand the outflow effect, if those species are detected. N2D+ also has hyperfine components and CH3CCD has a different K lines, and hence we need large bandwidth of 117 MHz. Thus, we need large "data rate" which exceeds the "policy" value of 12 MB/s.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: Methane (CH4) is the most fundamental organic molecule, and is an abundant constituent in interstellar clouds and planetary atmospheres. In addition to this general importance, we recently found its important role in some low-mass star forming regions, called warm-carbon-chain-chemistry (WCCC) sources, where CH4 evaporated from grain mantle near the protostar triggers efficient production of various carbon-chain molecules. In this proposal, we aim at the first definitive detection of deuterated methane (CH3D) by observing its the J=1-0 and 2-1 lines in Band 6 and 8, respectively, in the WCCC source L1527. L1527 is an ideal source for this purpose because of a high expected abundance of CH4 and a warm and dense condition for rotational excitation. We have recently reported the tentative detection of CH3D in L1527 by a long integration observation with the single dish telescope (HHT), and hence, we would like to confirm this detection definitively with ALMA by observing the two rotational lines. This observation will open a new window to the CH4 science in star and planet forming regions. It will also be a definitive proof of the WCCC mechanism in L1527.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:previousProposals: This is the resubmission of previously approved proposal, 2013.1.01331.S, ranked B. The Band 6 observation of the total power measurement has not been done, while the 12m and 7m interferometric data are delivered. The Band 8 observation has not been conducted. Thus, we request only the total power data and the Band 8 data.
